algorithm_technique: Iterate through matrix elements, checking diagonal and non-diagonal conditions.
problem_summary_simple: Is a square matrix an X-Matrix where diagonals are non-zero and other elements are zero?
problem_summary_technical: Verify if elements on main/anti-diagonals are non-zero and all other elements are zero in an n x n matrix.
key_insights: An X-Matrix has specific conditions for diagonal elements (non-zero) and off-diagonal elements (zero).
The conditions can be checked by iterating through each cell and verifying its position relative to the diagonals.
The condition `(i-j == 0 or i+j == len(grid)-1) == (grid[i][j] != 0)` elegantly combines both requirements.
